node.title: Respecting Food
node.label: 11. September 2020
node.introduction: Have you ever thought about the meals you eat and given them a respect ranking? What does this even mean?

node.title: Top Tips for Picky Eaters
node.label: 10. September 2020
node.introduction: Some people just don't like a lot of food or let's just say, they like what they like and that's all there is to it!

node.title: Creamy Smoked Mackerel Pate
node.introduction: Mackerel is a good source of protein and is high in omega three. Serve with vegetable sticks to count towards your five a day.

node.title: Chocolate, Orange, Coco-nutty Clusters
node.introduction: Dark chocolate can stimulate the production of endorphins. This is because it contains tryptophan, an amino acid that is a precursor to the feel good hormone; serotonin. It can make us feel happy, create feelings of pleasure, as well as reduce pain.

node.title: Raspberry Ripple Pancakes with Pineapple Skewers
node.introduction: These quick pancakes are fun to make and have a pleasing pink ripple effect due to the crushed raspberries. Serve with a big dollop of yogurt and the pineapple skewers on the side and this basic recipe can be a tasty and nutritious breakfast, brunch or snack.

node.cover_image_alt: Raspberry Ripple Pancakes with Pineapple Skewers.

node.text:
TEST DON’T GUESS!

Often doctors say there's no point in testing during perimenopause because our hormones are fluctuating throughout the month.

And they are right! Hormone blood testing that you get from your GP is not very reliable, it’s just a snapshot of one hormone in the blood at that time. 

But there are other ways to test that can be really useful to identify exactly what your hormones are doing, so that you can support them. 

State of the art urine testing can really be a game changer. They give the best results to make sure YOU get the answers YOU need to start addressing your hormones and get back to feeling normal again.

Here's 4  BENEFITS of investing in private hormones testing:

1. It’s personal to YOU - no more generic protocols, you can focus on specific foods to make sure you have the nutrients you need. 
2. No guesswork - testing is a road map, it gives direction. Any supplements you take you know you will need you won't be guessing. 
3. It gives a starting point so you can measure and track your progress. 
4. It’s empowering - when you know exactly what’s wrong, it's easier to make lasting changes and see results. 

Have you already taken or considered a private hormone test before?  Y/N Tell me in the comments 👇

This simple technique can see off a headache within minutes!

I’ve suffered with headaches and migraines all my life but since I started practicing alternate nostril breathing I've hardly touched the pills. In fact I haven't collected my prescription for my migraine medication for months!

It's rare that I even get headaches now especially since I eliminated my food triggers and put some lifestyle changes into place. But if I do, this simple nostril breathing technique stops a headache in its tracks. 

What are you going to do next time you get a headache? 
A. Pop a pill?
B. Try this useful technique?
Sound familiar? Drop a ♥️ in the comments if this is you!

metadata.siteDescription: ENERGISE, RESTORE, NOURISH. I'm studying with the renowned Institute for Optimum Nutrition and will qualify next year. Until then, this is a place to inspire and share healthful information, tips, tricks and recipes. I hope to energise, restore and nourish your body mind and soul!
